title: With Sterak's gage being nerfed Morde's in an even worse state
body:
It happened before with the Trinity force changes and it will happen again with Sterak's gage.
Mordekaiser relies heavily on his itemisation due to his abysmally low base values and needs to invest in defense early to not die like the squishiest mage.

And now with Steraks gage, an item that's SUPPOSED to be a Juggernaut core choice, losing 100 health Morde's getting once again shafted by changes to his items.

This could easily be avoided if Sterak's gage was limited to melee only like Hydra but Riot will probably stick to their usual agenda of nerfing the items instead of certain champions abusing them.

//rant//

> Just want to jump in here for a clarification: Graves is absolutely not the reason why Sterak's Gage is being nerfed - nor are any other Marksmen.

> Looking at usage on that item by Fighters and Tanks only, we're seeing usage rates spike dramatically - it's trending up right now the way Rageblade trended up in patch 5.22. That kind of red flag will get us to look at an item, though it doesn't necessarily mean there's something wrong. However, in looking at it, we concluded that its stat efficiency is simply too high for its cost; it's worth getting even if you only marginally care about the unique stuff it does, even if you don't have great base Attack Damage.

> As a general rule, we try not to change items because of specific champions that change the rules of how stats work in the game (think Ryze with mana, Kog'Maw breaking the AS cap, or Graves devaluing AS and Crit for himself with basic attack rules changes). If we had to balance all of our AS/On Hit items around Kog'Maw, it'd be nearly impossible to make champions like Kayle feel good about their item paths. I won't say that we'll never do it, but it would be a last resort.

> Now, we do pay attention to how other classes use items. If Marksmen in general (not just Graves specifically) were the best users of Sterak's Gage, we'd have to balance around that reality. That's not what we're seeing right now - there is some fringe non-Graves non-Kalista marksman usage of the item, but not a lot and it's not 'breaking' the class at this moment.

That nerf isn't the right choice, imo.
Sterak isn't an issue on champions like Morde, Garen and Darius (who are supposed to be the ones that build Sterak).
It becomes an issue on champions like Fiora, Graves and Yi because they abuse it.
The problem could be solved by changing how Sterak's shield work and making it scale off bonus health instead of max hp.

If one item being nerfed drastically affects a champion, then the problem isn't with the item, but with the champion. Riot needs to seriously consider giving Mordekaiser more Base HP like so many other fighters because he's no longer the same mage that wrecked early game to fall off later. Just as they had to give a load of fighters more stats given they were outdated with the progression of the game, Mordekaiser needs to see the same treatment.  

If Riot's issue with Sterak's was with its being used a lot by ranged, they would have just made it "melee only" OR reduce its effectiveness on Ranged champions to be less appealing by reducing its stats on Ranged. 

That said, the last thing I thought of when Riot nerfed Sterak's was "Graves is OP, so they're nerfing it as a result". Sterak's has been a greatly effective, if not the most effective, item this entire season; nerfing it like they did DMP (literally the same nerf) does not surprise me one bit. If it's being build on Fiora it's an indication that something is wrong, she's supposed to want bonus ad, not base ad. It could be the item, it could be overall synergy of a bunch of items, or something else, but _something_ is wrong.

The problem is that Yi and Fiora both have mechanics/items that let them deal very good damage while building tank. Devourer on Yi is so broken that building that and one other damage item is enough to let him destroy anything. People building glass cannon could destroy things faster but a team working together could hopefully cc Yi and kill him before he dropped someone, the bruiser build doubles his assassination time, but almost completely removes that weakness to cc.

Fiora is the same way in that she has to take longer to kill targets, but her passive still gives her enough damage with bruiser items that she ends up being about as threatening as your standard bruiser, but with the mobility and survival mechanics of the light fighter she's supposed to be.
